strings: <se_low>King Trode: Brrr...

<se_low>King Trode: It's positively f-freezing here!
I'm afraid I'm not very good in the cold.
Let's try not to dawdle.
<se_low>Yangus: We ain't never been through this tunnel before, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: On the map, all ya can see is a place wiv mountains all 'round it, and there ain't no other way in. Could be int'restin'!
<se_def>Angelo: If only I didn't have to travel in the company of such brainless fools!

<se_def>Angelo: Now's no time for exploring new places, for Goddess's sake!
We have to go back and help Jessica!

<se_low>Yangus: Huh! I was just showin' a bit of int'rest.
No need for no one to get their knickers in a twist!

<se_low>Yangus: I s'pose Angelo's right, though.
Better save the explorin' for another time.
<se_def>Angelo: We don't really need to come up here now, do we? I'm worried about Jessica anyway, so maybe we can leave the scenic detours for another time.
<se_low>King Trode: Brrr. It's absolutely f-freezing again.

<se_low>King Trode: This won't do my old arthritis any g-good at all.
Oh, why am I made to s-suffer like this!? Brrr!
<se_low>Yangus: People say there's snow all over the place once you come out the end o' this tunnel.
<se_low>Yangus: I ain't never seen snow before.
<se_low>Yangus: I'm pretty excited, actually. Woo-hooooo!
<se_high>Jessica: If Leopold really ran up ahead, we don't have any choice but to go after him.

<se_high>Jessica: Still, it's hard to motivate yourself to go into the freezing cold.
I should have put on more layers!
<se_def>Angelo: The Lord of Darkness seems to have some kind of power to sense where the descendants of the sages are.

<se_def>Angelo: That's pretty cool.
I wish I had something similar so I could locate pretty girls.

<se_low>King Trode: This is the only entrance to the snow c-country, and yet we're the only ones here.
What a lonely p-place.
<se_low>Yangus: It's good that the tunnel's wide enough for the 'orse an' cart, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: It'd be a shame if the ol' codger an' the 'orse-princess couldn't come wiv us an' see the snow.
<se_high>Jessica: I realise it's his duty, but it must be hard spending so much time in such a lonely place! What a job!
<se_high>Jessica: I wonder if he'll lose the ability to communicate with other people if he stays by himself for too long!

<se_def>Angelo: Why are you stopping?
There's nothing to see here.
Let's keep going.
<se_low>King Trode: This t-tunnel's as empty and freezing as ever.

<se_low>King Trode: I suppose it's understandable.
Who would come all this way at a time like this, after all?
<se_low>Yangus: We can fly now, so I s'pose we don't really need to be comin' through this tunnel no more...

<se_low>Yangus: I'm sure you've got yer reasons, though, guv.
I'd never doubt ya.
<se_high>Jessica: The whole world's going crazy, but there's that man, standing guard as always.

<se_high>Jessica: Loyalty or obliviousness?
It's hard to tell.

<se_def>Angelo: Why are you stopping?
There's nothing to see here.
Let's keep going.
<se_low>Morrie: Maybe it is my immaginazione, but I feel things getting stiff in my body, and my knees knocking each other up. Maybe it's the grosso black canine, ay? His magic is reaching us here.
<se_low>Morrie: If I am going missing, will you swear that you gonna look after the arena for me, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Si? FANTASTICO! Then from this momento on, ragazzo is officially the successor of the Monster Arena <endash> the heir of my monstrous pit!
<se_high>Jessica: Look, can we stop wasting time like this, and get out of this horrible tunnel? I could really do with finding a town and warming myself up.
<se_low>Morrie: Si? FANTASTICO! Then from this momento on, ragazzo is officially the successor of the Monster Arena <endash> the heir of my monstrous pit!
<se_low>Morrie: .........
<se_high>Jessica: Morrie, I'm pretty sure that was a refusal, actually.
<se_low>Morrie: Che? Ah, s-si, you are right. ...Va bene. What ya gonna do, ay?
<se_high>Red: Am I missin' somefin'? Is there some reason for comin' through 'ere? Wouldn't we be better off airborne? Ya know, where Rhapthorne actually IS!
<se_low>Morrie: Just through this brief gallery, and we go from the fiery leaves of the autumn to the snowy mountains! It's like some kind of magic, ay?
